result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph J. Abbott

records.addlTxt: Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Hirschman.  Victim notification complied with.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 2, in 15CM310. Remainint charges in 15CM310, plus 14CM234 and 15CM303 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 2, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Special Prosecutor, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Hirschman.  Set for plea/sentencing.
Status conference on March 5, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Hirschman.  Have an offer today.  Attorney Hirschman recently appointed.  STC set for 3/5 at 3 pm.
Lisa Hirschman
Status conference on February 5, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  He applied for SPD representation today.  He qualifies.  STC set for 2/5 at 3 p.m.

This bond covers 3 cases 15CM310; 14CM234 and 15CM303:    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: M. M. and J. M.

Defendant fails to appear.  Attorney SPD David Wilson appears in court.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Wilson states he doesn't know why his client is not present.  He requests a 1 week adjournment to try to contact him and have him come in.  Court authorizes a warrant on all 3 pending cases.

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with counsel SPD David Wilson present in the courtroom.  DA Fox appeared for the State.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. SPD David Wilson appears in person with defendant by video from JASO.  DA Fox appeared for the state.  Waives reading of complaint and defendant stands mute.  Court enters not guilty plea with PTC set for 1-13-16 and status for 2-1-16. 14CM234 will track with this case.  Bond requested by DA for $1000 cash bond with same conditions as 14CM234.  Court orders $100 cash with same condtions as requested.
